definition: thorn/sting/thrust/to prick/to pierce/to stab/to assassinate/to murder

sentences.english: There's a funny smell of soot blowing down the chimney.
sentences.chinese: 烟囱里倒灌进一股刺鼻的煤烟。

sentences.english: SO2 is a colourless gas with a sharp odour.
sentences.chinese: 二氧化硫是一种无色气体，带有刺鼻的气味。

sentences.english: At times, the smell from the gutter can be rank.
sentences.chinese: 从下水沟时常冒出刺鼻的气味。

sentences.english: The pungent, choking smell of sulphur filled the air.
sentences.chinese: 空气中弥漫着刺鼻呛人的硫磺气味。

sentences.english: Soldiers sprayed disinfectant over the debris to cover the stench of rotting bodies.
sentences.chinese: 部队对废墟喷洒了消毒液来掩盖刺鼻的腐烂尸体味道。

sentences.english: The room filled with the acrid smell of tobacco.
sentences.chinese: 房间里弥漫着刺鼻的烟草味。

sentences.english: To people's amazement, there was no wastepaper or pungent smell at the scene.
sentences.chinese: 让人称奇的是，现场竟无纸屑和刺鼻气味。

sentences.english: A pungent odour met their nostrils.
sentences.chinese: 他们闻到一种刺鼻的气味。

sentences.english: Also, no one wants to walk into a wall of cologne, " Megaro says.
sentences.chinese: 还有，也没人愿意走进一间充满刺鼻香水味的房间。

sentences.english: It has expunged the odour of decay that was once tangy with the chemical flavour of explosives and spent phosphorous.
sentences.chinese: 曾经爆炸和燃过白磷的刺鼻化学气味已经消退了。

sentences.english: The smell of mothballs is very pungent.
A little smell of perfume may be nice, but a lot can smell too strong.
sentences.chinese: 一点香水味不错，但太过浓烈可能就刺鼻了。

definition: to smell/to sniff sth out/to perceive by smelling
to assail the nostrils (of fragrance and odors)
smell of alcohol/flavoring of rum or other liquor in food/aroma or nose (of wine)
